stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Uncover Malicious AI Extension Sending Code to Chinese Servers
stories.summary: A newly discovered malicious AI extension, MaliciousCorgi, has been found sending users' code to servers in China, raising concerns about data security and AI model vulnerabilities.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrency: The Enduring Legacy of the Actor Model
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper introduces the Actor model, a groundbreaking framework for concurrent computation that has influenced decades of research and development in distributed systems and artificial intelligence. The model's innovative approach to asynchronous communication and parallel processing remains relevant in today's era of massive-scale computing.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Expands Internal Adoption of Claude Code Across Key Engineering Teams
stories.summary: Microsoft is rolling out Anthropic's Claude Code to thousands of employees, including non-developers, for everyday coding tasks, signaling a shift towards a multi-tool AI strategy. The company is evaluating Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot for productivity gains and potential future offerings.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Expands AI Research Team with New Applied Researcher Hire
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is seeking an applied researcher to join its team and drive innovation in machine learning. This hire underscores the company's commitment to advancing AI capabilities.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Secrets of Scalable Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach
stories.summary: Researchers are developing a science of scaling agent systems, exploring when and why these systems succeed or fail, with implications for AI applications. The study reveals key factors influencing agent system performance and reliability.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Muscle Stem Cells' Adaptive Shift: A Trade-Off Between Rapid Repair and Longevity
stories.summary: Researchers have discovered that aging muscle stem cells prioritize long-term survival over rapid repair, shedding light on the mechanisms behind muscle degeneration. This shift may hold the key to developing novel therapies for age-related muscle loss.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking Efficiency: Nano-vLLM's Innovative Approach to Inference Engine Design
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM introduces a novel inference engine architecture inspired by vLLM, optimizing performance and efficiency in large language model deployments. This breakthrough has significant implications for AI applications.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLMs: Garbage Output Raises Concerns
stories.summary: Apple's iPhone 16 Pro Max is producing subpar results when running MLX large language models, sparking concerns about device performance and model compatibility. Developers are working to optimize models for better results.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough Code: NanoClaw Revolutionizes Robotics with 500 Lines of TypeScript
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a compact and innovative robotic project, showcases the power of Apple container isolation, setting a new standard for robotics development.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Adopters Take Shape
stories.summary: As artificial intelligence continues to permeate various aspects of life, a stark contrast is emerging between two types of users, highlighting a growing gap in how individuals interact with and leverage AI technologies.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Develop Novel Approach to Reverse-Engineer Wordle Solutions with Unparalleled Accuracy
stories.summary: A new study presents a method to accurately deduce Wordle answers from shared score histories, shedding light on the puzzle's inner workings and sparking interesting implications for similar word games.

stories.original_title: The Reasons Teens Say No to AI
stories.generated_headline: Adolescent Reservations: Unpacking Teenagers' Resistance to Artificial Intelligence
stories.summary: A recent survey reveals the top reasons teenagers are hesitant to embrace AI technology, shedding light on the concerns that developers and policymakers need to address.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source AI Tool Outperforms Google in Deep Research Tasks
stories.summary: A new open-source project, Project Lutum Veritas, claims to surpass Google's capabilities in deep research tasks, backed by empirical evidence and transparent methodology. The project's innovative approach and impressive results spark interest in the AI research community.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Preserved Brain Structure in Middle-Aged Adults, Study Finds
stories.summary: A recent study using MRI scans reveals that regular physical activity may help maintain a younger brain structure, potentially mitigating age-related cognitive decline. The findings suggest a strong correlation between exercise and brain health.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reverses Course on Windows 11 AI Features Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-powered features in Windows 11, responding to user concerns over intrusive updates and performance issues. The move signals a shift towards a more user-centric approach to AI integration.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: OxCaml Powers Zero-Allocation Web Server for High-Performance Computing
stories.summary: A developer showcases their fast, allocation-free web server built with OxCaml, highlighting its potential for high-performance applications.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: AI Investment Trends: Are Enterprises Rushing to Judgment?
stories.summary: As AI capabilities accelerate, industry experts question whether companies are prematurely scaling back investments, potentially missing out on transformative 6G technologies. The trend raises concerns about the long-term implications for innovation and competitiveness.
